result.execSummary:
Linda T Nguyen was extradited to another county, state or jurisdiction. Extradition means Linda T Nguyen was accused or convicted of an offense in another county, state or jurisdiction and was taken there to face their charge(s) or conviction.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Linda T Nguyen

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Linda T Nguyen not in court.  Michael J. Odden appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant has been turned over to the State of OKLAHOMA on 07.25.2022.
On motion of the state, Court ordered case closed.

Defendant Linda T Nguyen in court with attorney Michael J Cerniglia.  Defendant Linda T Nguyen in custody.  Nate Kristian McClure appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38. Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of rights and right to file a Writ of Habeas Corpus.  Court found the defendant is the person wanted in the State of Oklahoma. Defendant waived extradition.  Court ordered Defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.
 https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/0a25f782-7319-dd31-4ed9-c0f452a2bc2b  Status conference scheduled for August 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
